abstract: Kentucky Gov Steven L Beshear of Kentucky vigorously defends his expansion of state's Medicaid offerings under Affordable Care Act, urging Republican Gov-elect Matt Bevin to keep program in place; argues decision holds up from business standpoint as well as human standpoint; Bevin previously indicated he would roll back program but has come to suggest he may seek federal permission to reshape it instead.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Steven L. Beshear of Kentucky defended his expansion of Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, imploring the governor-elect to keep the program.

headline.main: Kentucky Governor Issues Parting Plea to Successor on Health Care System
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Governor Issues Parting Plea to Successor on Health Care System

snippet: Gov. Steven L. Beshear of Kentucky defended his expansion of Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, imploring the governor-elect to keep the program.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
